captions.text:
[intro music]
TJ BURNS: All the way up? DIRECTOR: All the way up.
TJ: I'm TJ Elevator Fan.

I LOVE elevators!
[intro music]
ANDREA COON: My name is Andrea Coon. I'm the general manager of the Hampton Inn -- Tunnel Road
Asheville, North Carolina.
I was at a meeting and
Kayla, my front desk person, called me and said,
"TJ Elevator Fan is here!"
"He just checked in!"

And I was like, "okay... WHO checked in!?"
[Kayla said]  "His dad says that he has his own website

and it's really great, and he's so cute! I
really wanna do something special
for him!"
JULIE: As far back as I can remember he's
loved elevators. I don't know how many elevators

we've actually filmed. At least in the thousands
JEFF BURNS: You know you never expect that uh
you're gonna be taking vacations to ride elevators!
JULIE: I'm Julie Burns, and I'm TJ Elevator Fan's Mom.
JEFF: Hi, I'm Jeff Burns. I'm TJ Elevator Fan's Dad.
TJ: I look for the brand, which normally I can tell by the buttons
There's like impulse Dovers,

with square buttons. 
And classic Dovers, with circle buttons.
ANDREA: We were like... ok...

I don't know what we can do
with so short notice!
We tried to brainstorm and come up with something special
'cause he loves elevators...

So I was like... we gotta do a video! 
When I came in the next morning

TJ was in the lobby. 
I said, "would you like to be part of our team huddle?"

ANDREA, FROM VIDEO THAT DAY:
His name is TJ

and he is a huge fan of Hampton.
[team members cheer]
JULIE: He's got mild cerebral palsy.
Well, he went through physical therapy, and his therapist,

Miss Sherri, would use the elevator... 
"if you do five more reps, we'll go ride the elevator!"
JULIE: Early on, he just didn't have a lot of control in his life

and that was one thing that we did let
him have complete control.
ANDREA: We went straight from huddle to the elevator

everybody piled in. 
JEFF: And they probably had

10 or 12 people trying to go into the elevator.
TJ: It was one full elevator!

TEAM HAMPTON, FROM VIDEO:
TJ has Hamptonality in Asheville, North Carolina!
[team cheering]
TJ: It was wonderful!
It really meant a lot to me.
ANDREA: My intention was to have an impact on him.
I had no idea that TJ would have such an impact on us!
JEFF: When he's really excited you're excited...

it's just something to spend time with
TJ, too. And we get to
spend time as a family
JULIE: I think going through what we did

it's made you really appreciate the fact that
he is alive, and he made it!
And it's just a celebration of life.
ANDREA: I think that he is amazing.
He makes my heart smile!

JULIE: [laughing] Ohh... I don't know. TJ can wear something into the ground.
JEFF: We hope it continues for

for a while. He doesn't seem like he's slowing down! 
As long as we can find elevators to ride,

he'll be ridin' 'em!
[music]

comments.text:
Guys you gotta realize, this is a MARKETING PLOY!!  Hampton is just like 
any other business!  They need to make a profit!  Sure this seems nice what 
they did.  They did NOT do it out of the kindness of their heart! They are 
doing it to try to get BUSINESS!!  There is nothing wrong with it but 
remember this is a PR thing!  I don't really agree with doing it about a 
kid and exploiting a story like this.  I have watched the kids youtube, he 
is not doing anything special,  just recording elevators like hundreds of 
other kids..﻿

comments.text:
TJ is so full of happiness, and has such an amazing outlook on life. I feel 
so blessed to have personally experienced his infectious joy, and I applaud 
Hampton for allowing him this wonderful opportunity. We could all learn a 
thing or two from TJ, especially those who somehow find something negative 
or offensive to say. If only they could meet TJ... if only they could see 
for themselves... he would definitely touch their hearts.

comments.text:
We like to share our COOL person of the week.

His name is TJElevatorfan and you can learn more about him by watching this 
video ==> TJ Elevator Fan: Elevated Hamptonality

You can find more about TJ Elevator Fan on the following sites:
Website: http://tjelevatorfan.com/
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/tjelevatorfan
Twitter: https://twitter.com/tjelevatorfan
YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/tjelevatorfan

How COOL is that to love riding elevators! Keeping going TJ!﻿

comments.text:
Paco Alemán, We are extremely honored to be working with TJ for a million 
reasons, just one of them being that he doesn’t let any health condition 
stop him from living an amazing life discovering the world one elevator at 
a time. We ask that you please be respectful to him, his family and our 
community. As always, we reserve the right to remove posts that we find 
offensive. Thank you for your cooperation and we truly hope you enjoy our 
Hamptonality Moments!

comments.text:
*This is a TERRIFIC ad that will break your heart!*

I remember seeing an interview with one of the Google founders where he 
said that the "Skip This Ad" option would improve ads. Boy it has. I was 
watching a video from a channel that +Linda Lawrey told me about and this 
video was the ad. I never clicked the Skip button and just let it roll. It 
is a wonderful story about a little guy who... I'll just let the ad do the 
talking.

Here is more about this awesome young man: http://goo.gl/Lp6BA

And thanks to the Hampton Inn for giving this kid 4 minutes of well 
deserved fame!

+Vic Gundotra ﻿
comments.author: Dan McDermott
